snippet: A fresh chapter for the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles will begin with a nest egg and a new director.
abstract: Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles, after three years of tumultous leadership, says it is nearing the end of a search for a new director; also announces it has raised its endowment to $100 million, fund-raising milestone that will ensure it does not have to merge with another institution or face dissolution.

byline.original: By RANDY KENNEDY and CAROL VOGEL

lead_paragraph: A fresh chapter for the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles will begin with a nest egg and a new director.

headline.main: A Once-Troubled Museum Frames a Future in Los Angeles
headline.print_headline: A Once-Troubled Museum Frames a Future in Los Angeles

keywords.value: Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art
keywords.name: organizations
